WHAT_IS_APP.TITLE: What is the app?
WHAT_IS_APP.DESCRIPTION: This is an app that will take you step by step to do the Mini Cog test with a loved one.

WHAT_IS_MINICOG.TITLE: What is  Mini Cog?
WHAT_IS_MINICOG.DESCRIPTION: The Mini Cog test is a brief cognitive screening test that is used to detect cognitive impairment in older adults. It consists of a three-item recall test for memory and a simple clock-drawing test.

WHO_IS_THIS_FOR.TITLE: Who is this for?
WHO_IS_THIS_FOR.DESCRIPTION: This test is designed to be administered by one person to another, such as a family member or loved one.

BEFORE_WE_START.TITLE: Before we start
BEFORE_WE_START.TOOLS: Grab a pencil, and a paper
BEFORE_WE_START.PERSON_ATTENTION: Make sure the person is paying attention
BEFORE_WE_START.EXPLAIN: Explain that you are going to ask them to remember three words and draw a clock
BEFORE_WE_START.QUIET_PLACE: Find a quiet place without distractions

WORD_RECALL.TITLE: 3 Word Recall
WORD_RECALL.DESCRIPTION: In this part of the test, you will ask the person to remember three words. You will say the words one at a time and ask the person to repeat them. After you have said all three words, ask the person to repeat them again. If the person can remember all three words, they will move on to the next part of the test.
WORD_RECALL.REPEAT: Repeat the words if necessary, but do not provide any additional information or cues.
WORD_RECALL.UNABLE_REPEAT: If the person is unable to repeat the words after three attempts, move on to Step 2 (clock drawing)..
WORD_RECALL.ASK_REPEAT: After saying the three words, ask the person to repeat them.
WORD_RECALL.LOOK: Look at the person directly and say:
WORD_RECALL.PLEASE_LISTEN: “Please listen carefully. I am going to say three words that I want you to repeat now and try to remember.

CLOCK_DRAWING.TITLE: Clock Drawing
CLOCK_DRAWING.DESCRIPTION: Give the person a blank sheet of paper and a pen or pencil.
CLOCK_DRAWING.CIRCLE_PAPER: It is acceptable to provide a sheet of paper with the circle already drawn for the person.
CLOCK_DRAWING.REQUEST: Say: “Next, I want you to draw a clock for me. First, put in all of the numbers where they go.”
CLOCK_DRAWING.DRAW_HOUR: When that is completed, say: “Now, set the hands to 10 past 11.”
CLOCK_DRAWING.REPEAT_INFO: Repeat instructions as needed as this is not a memory test.
CLOCK_DRAWING.UNABLE_DRAW: Move to Step 3 if the clock is not complete within three minutes.

SCORE_WORDS.TITLE: Scoring the word recall
SCORE_WORDS.REQUEST: You will be asking the person to recall the set of 3 words you gave them at the beginning of the test.
SCORE_WORDS.QUESTION: Say, “What were the three words I asked you to remember?”
SCORE_WORDS.WRITE_DOWN: Write down the words the person said
SCORE_WORDS.SCORE_BASIS: Give 1 point for each correct word without cues.

SCORE_CLOCK.TITLE: Scoring the Clock Drawing
SCORE_CLOCK.SCORE_BASIS: 2 points for a normal clock or 0 (zero) points for an abnormal clock drawing.
SCORE_CLOCK.CORRECT_CLOCK: A normal clock must include all numbers (1-12), each only once, in the correct order and direction (clockwise).
SCORE_CLOCK.CORRECT_HANDS: There must also be two hands present, one pointing to the 11 and one pointing to 2.

RESULTS.TITLE: Results
RESULTS.BRIEF_DESCRIPTION: Total score = Word Recall score + Clock Draw score.
RESULTS.CUT_POINT: A cut point of less than 3 on the Mini-Cog™ has been validated for dementia screening, but many individuals with clinically meaningful cognitive impairment will score higher.
RESULTS.INTERPRETATION: When greater sensitivity is desired, a cut point of less than 4 is recommended as it may indicate a need for further evaluation of cognitive status.
